info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:39PM EDT until further notice by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR ELKHART...SOUTHEASTERN ST. JOSEPH AND NORTHEASTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 639 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wakarusa, or 7 miles southeast of Mishawaka, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... South Bend, Elkhart, Mishawaka, Goshen, Nappanee, Bremen, Dunlap, Gulivoire Park, Middlebury, Osceola, Wakarusa, Millersburg, New Paris, Benton, Locke, Woodland, Jimtown, Southwest, Foraker and Waterford Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
